section.SSBody:
Thank you for your interest in the Gunn Robotics Team's summer camp! The dates for the camp are TBD. We will let you know immeddiately after they are finalized.

Come enjoy a thrilling and valuable robotics experience with GRT! Campers will collaborate to build and code a fully-functioning VEX IQ robot to complete robotic challenges while learning the fundamental skills for being an engineer.

When and where is it?The summer camp will be held at the Gunn HS Robotics Lab (L-5) at Gunn High School. The two identical camp sessions will be held early in the summer, from June 8 - 12 and June 15 - 19. We recommend that younger 5th to 6th grade campers sign up for the first week, and that older 7th to 8th grade campers sign up for the second week.

Who is the camp for?The summer camp is designed for campers from rising 5th graders to rising 8th graders.

Should I donate to the camp?We request a donation of $350 for each camper to cover material costs and snacks. We are grateful for any amount you can donate. To donate, please use our Paypal or mail a check addressed to "GRT Booster" to Gunn Robotics Team, 780 Arastradero Road, Palo Alto, CA 94306. Contact us at gunnrobotics192@gmail.com for scholarship information.

How should I register my camper?Our registration application will be available in early spring.

Who are the counselors?GRT adult mentors will be present to supervise the summer camp. The counselors running the camp and teaching the course material are current students on the Gunn HS Robotics Team! All of our counselors are enthusiastic and eager to teach, and are all trained in the coding and assembly of VEX IQ robotics.

Will food be provided?We ask that your child bring their own lunch and reusable water bottle. We will provide snacks throughout the day.

I have other questions, who should I ask?If you have other questions, please contact us at gunnrobotics192@gmail.com.
